front.title: Use of Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) Algorithms in Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS)

abstract.t: This document describes how to use Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) public-key algorithms in the Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS). The ECC algorithms support the creation of digital signatures and the exchange of keys to encrypt or authenticate content. The definition of the algorithm processing is based on the NIST FIPS 186-3 for digital signature, NIST SP800-56A for key agreement, RFC 3565 and RFC 3370 for key wrap and content encryption, NIST FIPS 180-3 for message digest, and RFC 2104 and RFC 4231 for message authentication code standards. This document will obsolete RFC 3278.
